graphanalysis

Class CalculateBounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphanalysis.CalculateBounds

  • public class CalculateBounds
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculate maximum and minimum bounds on the graph. TODO: Check where all this class is used and if it produces correct results.
    Author:
    Pranav Tendulkar

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Graph graph
      Graph to be analysed
      private Graph hsdf
      HSDF of the same graph.
      private int maxBufferSize
      Maximum Latency to be used for a design space exploration.
      private int maxLatency
      Maximum Latency to be used for a design space exploration.
      private int maxProcessors
      Maximum Number of processors to be used for a design space exploration.
      private int minBufferSize
      Minimum Buffer Size to be used for a design space exploration.
      private int minLatency
      Minimum Latency to be used for a design space exploration.
      (package private) int minPeriod
      Minimum Period to be used for a design space exploration.
      private Solutions solutions
      Solutions of the graph containing repetition count.

      Minimum buffer size required for execution of application in terms of bytes.

      Minimum buffer size required for execution of application in terms of tokens.

      Communication cost for a channel is calculated as (source port rate * token size ).
      int findMinWorkLoad()
      Find minimum workload for exploration.
      int findTotalWorkLoad()
      Total workload will be equal to sum of execution times of all the actors in the graph.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalculateBounds

        public CalculateBounds(Graph graph,
               Graph hsdf,
               Solutions solutions)
        Initialize the bounds calculation object.
        Parameters:
        graph - input graph to be analyzed
        hsdf - equivalent HSDF graph
        solutions - solutions of the input graph

      • CalculateBounds

        public CalculateBounds(Graph graph,
               Solutions solutions)
        Initialize the bounds calculation object. HSDF will be calculated internally.
        Parameters:
        graph - input graph to be analyzed
        solutions - solutions of the input graph

    • Method Detail

      • findMinWorkLoad

        public int findMinWorkLoad()
        Find minimum workload for exploration. It is the smallest execution time for an actor in the graph.
        Returns:
        minimum workload in the graph

      • findMinCommunicationCost

        public int findMinCommunicationCost()
        Communication cost for a channel is calculated as (source port rate * token size ). This method will return a minimum over all the channels.
        Returns:
        minimum communication cost

      • findMaxCommunicationCost

        public int findMaxCommunicationCost()
        Communication cost for a channel is calculated as (source port rate * token size ). This method will return a sum over all the channels.
        Returns:
        maximum communication cost

      • findTotalWorkLoad

        public int findTotalWorkLoad()
        Total workload will be equal to sum of execution times of all the actors in the graph.
        Returns:
        total workload in the graph

      • findMaxProcessors

        public int findMaxProcessors()
        A loose bound on maximum number of processors that can be used for scheduling.
        Returns:
        maximum number of processor this graph can use

      • findMaxBufferSizeInBytes

        public int findMaxBufferSizeInBytes()
        Maximum buffer size for an application in terms of bytes.
        Returns:
        Maximum buffer size in bytes.

      • findMaxBufferSizeInTokens

        public int findMaxBufferSizeInTokens()
        Maximum buffer size for an application in terms of tokens.
        Returns:
        Maximum buffer size in tokens.

      • findMinBufferSizeInBytes

        public int findMinBufferSizeInBytes()
        Minimum buffer size required for execution of application in terms of bytes. The formula is taken from Bhattacharya book on software synthesis.
        Returns:
        Minimum buffer size in bytes.

      • findMinBufferSizeInTokens

        public int findMinBufferSizeInTokens()
        Minimum buffer size required for execution of application in terms of tokens.
        Returns:
        Minimum buffer size in tokens.

      • findGraphMinPeriod

        public int findGraphMinPeriod()
        Minimum Period for the exploration of the graph.
        Returns:
        minimum period of the graph for exploration

      • findGraphMaxPeriod

        public int findGraphMaxPeriod()
        Maximum period for the period exploration of the graph. It can be infinite, but then we can use non-pipelined scheduling instead of pipelined.
        Returns:
        maximum period of the graph

      • findGraphMinLatency

        public int findGraphMinLatency()
        Finds minimum latency of the graph
        Returns:
        minimum latency of the graph for exploration

      • findGraphMaxLatency

        public int findGraphMaxLatency()
        Maximum latency of the graph for scheduling. This is equal to sum of (execution times * repetition count) for all the actors.
        Returns:
        Maximum latency of the graph
